articles.title: Andrés Cruz
articles.description: I hold a BA and MA in Political Science from Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile. My research interests are in political economy and quantitative methods.

articles.title: R Resources
articles.contents:
R for Political Data Science / AnalizaR Datos Políticos
Co-edited with Francisco Urdinez
A textbook that teaches R and the tidyverse from scratch using examples from Latin American political science. It was published by CRC Press (Routledge) in November 2020. The Spanish version is open-access and freely available online.
inexact



An R package to supervise fuzzy joins, i.e. a way to solve the common problem of non-standardized ID variables when joining data sets. A recording of my presentation about it at the Toronto Data Workshop on Reproducibility (2021) is on Youtube.
Programming for the Social Sciences (undergraduate class)

2021 UDP (in progress) | 2020 PUC

Since 2019 I have taught a computational social science class for undergraduate students at UDP and PUC. Syllabus and class materials are available in the links above (in Spanish).
